the vapor to allow only the vapor to be piped to the suction of each compressor. Liquid in the main suction accumulator drains by gravity into the liquid transfer vessel. The main suction accumulator is equipped with a high level float switch that is wired to shut down the compressors in the event of a high level situation. This prevents liquid ammonia from entering the compressors. Under normal conditions, the main suction accumulator contains low pressure vapor ammonia.

Liquid Transfer Vessels
The purpose of the liquid transfer vessels is to transfer liquid from the low side of the refrigeration system back to the high pressure receivers. The liquid transfer vessels receive liquid from the main suction accumulator. Once the liquid level in the liquid transfer vessels reaches the float switch, the three way solenoid valve is energized for a period of time causing the liquid transfer vessels to become subject to high pressure and allowing the liquid to drain, by gravity, into the high pressure receivers. Under normal conditions the liquid transfer vessels can contain either high or low pressure liquid and vapor.

Compressors
The purpose of the compressors is to raise the temperature and pressure of the low pressure gas in order to reject the heat absorbed in the evaporator to the atmosphere. The compressors receive low pressure vapor from the main suction accumulator and discharge high pressure vapor to the evaporative condensers. Each compressor has an integral oil separator that receives the high pressure vapor and separates residual oil from the ammonia so that the oil can be returned to the compressor. The compressors are equipped with high discharge pressure cutouts to shut the equipment off if the pressure exceeds the setpoint. Under normal conditions, the compressors contain both high and low pressure vapor ammonia.

Evaporative Condensers
The purpose of the evaporative condensers is to reject the heat absorbed in the evaporators and compressors to

m. Under normal conditions, the high pressure receivers contain high pressure liquid and vapor ammonia.

Flooded Accumulators
The purpose of each flooded accumulator is to provide a supply of low pressure liquid ammonia to the evaporators. Each accumulator is equipped with an expansion valve which expands the high pressure liquid into a low temperature and pressure liquid as it enters the vessel. The flooded accumulators supply, by gravity, low pressure liquid to the associated evaporators. Liquid and vapor returned from the evaporators is separated inside the flooded accumulators to allow only the vapor to be returned to the main suction accumulator. Under normal conditions, the flooded accumulators contain low pressure liquid and vapor ammonia.

Air-Cooling Evaporators (Flooded)
The purpose of the air-cooling evaporators is to remove heat from the air in order to maintain a predetermined space temperature. The air-cooling evaporators receive liquid from a flooded accumulator. The evaporators contain a set of continuous coils through which the low pressure liquid flows. Due to the low pressures and temperatures maintained in the evaporator, the liquid refrigerant absorbs a great deal of heat from the surrounding area and evaporates. To increase the rate of heat removed, the evaporators use an electric fan to move warm air over the coils of cold liquid ammonia. Once the liquid has evaporated to form low temperature and pressure vapor, it returns to the supplying vessel. The liquid ammonia enters the bottom of the evaporator coil and as the liquid boils into a vapor, it rises through the coil and returns to the flood accumulator. Under normal conditions, the air-cooling evaporators contain low pressure liquid and vapor ammonia.

Main Suction Accumulator
The purpose of the main suction accumulator is to prevent liquid from entering the compressors. The main suction accumulator receives vapor from the flooded accumulators and separates any residual liquid from

1.2.4 Process Chemistry

The refrigeration system employed at Vignolo Farms - Delmart is configured for flooded operation. The function and thermodynamics of each major component type in the system is summarized below:

High Pressure Receivers
The purpose of the high pressure receivers is to provide a safe location to add and store high pressure liquid ammonia in the refrigeration system. The high pressure receivers receive high pressure liquid from the condensers and supply high pressure liquid to each zone of refrigeration. The high pressure receivers are also used to provide storage for ammonia not being used in the system at any given moment. The high pressure receivers are equipped with a single main liquid feed shut-off valve (king valve) that is clearly labeled and can be used to stop the flow of ammonia throughout the syste

The RMP-PSM program sets forth rules, procedures and practices that will help our employees and neighbors protect themselves.

1.2 Process Description

1.2.1 Facility Overview

Vignolo Farms - Delmart operates a commercial cold storage plant for a variety of fruit and vegetables in Bakersfield, CA. The facility has an ammonia refrigeration system that provides refrigeration capacity to the following:
(6) Cold Storage Rooms
(4) Precool Rooms
(2) Hallways

1.2.2 Facility Location

Vignolo Farms - Delmart is located at 33342 Dresser Ave, Bakersfield, CA 93308. The latitude and longitude of the high pressure receivers is 36.495230, -119.469466. The facility is located approximately 2.5 miles east of state highway 99 in a rural area surrounded primarily by agriculture land.

According to FEMA Flood Map Service, the facility is located in an area of minimal flood hazard.
Vignolo Farms - Delmart is not located in an Alquist-Priolo Fault Zone as defined by the California Department of Conservation. In addition, a review of United States Geological Survey (USGS) fault maps showed that faults within close proximity are not considered high risk:
New Hope Fault - <150 Years
Kern Gorge Fault - <130,000 Years
Poso Creek Fault - <1,600,000 Years 
unnamed faults near Rag Gulch - <1,600,000 Years 

The USGS 2018 One-Year Model revealed that Vignolo Farms - Delmart has a 2-5% chance of experiencing potentially minor-damage due to ground shaking in 2018.

1.2.3 Description of Covered Process

The refrigerated areas are equipped with air-cooling evaporators and accumulators as required for flooded operation.
Most control valve groups are located on the roof to provide easy access. The refrigeration mach

tains three (3) valves.
Valve #1: High Side Discharge Valve
Valve #2: Low Side Discharge Valve
Valve #3: High to Low Pressure Control Valve
Opening Valve #1 will evacuate the process through the high pressure side of the system. Opening Valve #2 will evacuate the process through the low pressure side of the system. Opening Valve #3 will equalize the high and low pressure portions of the system. 

Relief Valves
All ASME pressure vessels and positive displacement compressors are equipped with relief valves designed to relieve pressure and protect the equipment from rupturing. Details regarding the relief valves are summarized below:
Each relief valve has a set pressure equal to or less than the MAWP of the equipment that the relief valve protects;
Each relief valve has a capacity which meets or exceeds the requirement of ANSI/IIAR 2-2021 §15.3.8;
All relief valves are connected to a common manifold which terminates into the ammonia diffusion tank;

Diffusion Tank
The refrigeration system is equipped with an ammonia diffusion tank which mitigates most of the hazards associated with a relief valve lifting. The relief valve discharge piping is terminated at the bottom of the ammonia diffusion tank. The ammonia diffusion tank is 12' dia. 24' high (20,000 gallon capacity). At a water level of 20', the tank contains 16,919 gallons of water which exceeds the quantity recommended by ANSI/IIAR 2-2021 §15.5.3 which is based on 1 gallon of water per pound of ammonia released through the largest relief valve in the system in 60 minutes. Under normal conditions, the ammonia diffusion tank contains water.

Screw Compressor Safety Devices
Each screw compressor has numerous safety devices to protect the compressor and the associated equipment. The following list summarizes the safety devices built into each screw compressor package:
High Discharge Pressure Cutout - The high discharge pressure cutout will shut down the compressor if the discharge pressure equals or ex

the atmosphere. The evaporative condensers receive high pressure, superheated vapor from the compressors and supply high pressure liquid to the high pressure receivers. The condensers use air and water to cool the warm ammonia as it passes through a series of tubes within the condensers. Water is contained in the sump of the condensers, which is then pumped and sprayed over the ammonia coil. As the cooling medium of air and water draws the heat from the vapor, the refrigerant condenses into a liquid and flows to the high pressure receivers. Under normal conditions, the evaporative condensers contain high pressure liquid and vapor ammonia.

1.2.5 Safety Systems

Ammonia Detection System

There are three ammonia detection hubs installed at Vignolo Farms - Delmart. Each hub is equipped with a detection hub and ammonia detection sensor extenders which monitor the air inside the rooms. The detection hubs provide ammonia detection to each room as summarized below:
Ammonia Detection Hub 1
Cold Storage Rooms 1-2, 4-5
Precool Room 1-2
Hallway
Machinery Room
Ammonia Detection Hub 2
Pre-cool Rooms 3-4
Cold Storage Room 3
Ammonia Detection Hub 3
Cold Storage Room 6

If the detection system detects an ammonia concentration exceeding 25 ppm, the system will activate visible and audible alarms and notify plant personnel of the situation through the auto-dialer.

Additionally, two (2) Calibration Technologies, Inc. (CTI) ammonia detectors are installed inside the machinery room. A CTI GG-NH3-100 provides low concentration detection and alerts personnel if the ammonia concentration exceeds 25 ppm. Audible/visual alarms are available outside and inside the machinery room. The low concentration detector will also activate the emergency ventilation system. A CTI GG-NH3-2% detector provides high concentration detection and will shut the system down.

Emergency Control Box
The Emergency Control Box (ECB) is installed on the north wall of the machinery room and con

employees our evacuation procedures in the event of an emergency, including a hazardous chemical release.

1.6 Planned Changes to Improve Safety

Vignolo Delmart Cold Storage has implemented many policies and procedures to promote overall plant, worker and public safety. Nevertheless, Vignolo Delmart Cold Storage continually strives to improve in all areas, including safety.

By utilizing PSMWriter software, all necessary employees have access to every aspect of the RMP-PSM program. This has improved Vignolo Delmart Cold Storage's ability to communicate hazardous situations to employees and contractors. In addition, PSMWriter tracks all RMP-PSM related events so that Vignolo Delmart Cold Storage's management team can ensure that the RMP-PSM program is being implemented.

Vignolo Delmart Cold Storage has implemented all aspects of the RMP-PSM program. When a RMP-PSM program requirement is completed (i.e. mechanical integrity inspection, process hazard analysis, compliance audit, etc.) any specific action items related to that event are entered into PSMWriter, assigned a responsible person, and given a due date. Once the action item has been completed, the resolution can be documented using PSMWriter as well. A list of current or past due action items can be accessed at any time by those with access to PSMWriter.

In addition to utilizing PSMWriter to create, schedule, track, and document events, Vignolo Delmart Cold Storage has also entered into a contract with Resource Compliance to obtain help with RMP-PSM program implementation.
For the future, Vignolo Delmart Cold Storage now thinks of the RMP-PSM program as a living document. It is an interactive framework that guides safe action for Vignolo Delmart Cold Storage employees, but allows for feedback and continual improvement. Through the RMP-PSM program Vignolo Delmart Cold Storage will continue to maintain overall plant worker and public safety.

se of anhydrous ammonia in annual safety meetings. During these meeting we also discuss preventative measures, such as evacuation, in order to be prepared for a release.
Vignolo Delmart Cold Storage has also conducted an off-site consequence analysis of worst-case and alternative release scenarios for the ammonia refrigeration process. These are for the purposes of informing the public in the event of an accidental release. The results of the analyses are reported in PSMWriter and hard copy binders. 

1.3.2 Anhydrous Ammonia

The ammonia refrigeration process at the Vignolo Delmart Cold Storage facility is an integral part of the overall business and operates most of the year. It is extremely important that this process is maintained and operated in a safe and efficient manner. Management is committed to making sure that employees are made aware of the potential danger of an ammonia leak.
Our refrigeration personnel monitor the ammonia refrigeration process and keep an active log book of all procedures and transactions that pertain to ammonia. In addition, the process is checked frequently by one of the outside refrigeration contractors that we use. These contractors also assist in performing the annual mechanical integrity inspection of our ammonia equipment.  

1.4 Five Year Accident History

Vignolo Delmart Cold Storage has had no accidental release within the last five (5) years.

1.5 Emergency Action and Response Plan

Vignolo Delmart Cold Storage's emergency action and response program has been developed to satisfy the following requirements:
California Emergency Action Plan - Title 8 CCR §3220
Federal Emergency Action Plan - Title 29 CFR §1910.38 

Strategically, we will respond minimally to a release. Under this plan we will call emergency personnel and evacuate the facility. All response activities would be done in coordination with the Local Fire Department and their Hazardous Materials Response Team. 
Every year we review with our

ceeds the setpoint.
Low Suction Pressure Cutout - The low suction pressure cutout will shut down the compressor if the suction pressure is equal to or less than the setpoint.
Oil Pressure Cutout - The oil pressure cutout will shut down the compressor if the oil pressure is equal to or less than the setpoint.
High Oil Temperature Cutout - The high oil temperature cutout will shut down the compressor if the oil temperature equals or exceeds the setpoint.
Low Oil Temperature Cutout - The low oil temperature cutout will shut down the compressor if the oil temperature is equal to or less than the setpoint.
Discharge Temperature Cutout - The high discharge temperature cutout will shut down the compressor if the discharge temperature equals or exceeds the setpoint.

High Level Float Switch
The main suction accumulator is equipped with a high level float switch that is wired to shut down the compressors in the event of a high liquid level in the vessel. This prevents liquid ammonia from entering the compressors.
Main Liquid Feed Shut-Off Valve (King Valve)
High Pressure Receiver 1 is equipped with a main liquid feed shut-off valve (king valve) that is clearly labeled and can be used to stop the flow of ammonia throughout the system.

Emergency Refrigeration Switch (E-Stop)
The principal entrance to the machinery room is equipped with an emergency refrigeration switch (e-stop) that controls power to the refrigeration machinery inside the machinery room. The switch can be activated in an emergency by pushing the red button.

1.2.6  Process Classification
The ammonia refrigeration system at Vignolo Farms - Delmart consists of vessels, equipment, and valves which are interconnected by piping. As such, the refrigeration system at Vignolo Farms - Delmart is treated as a single process.

Executive Summary

This program is intended to meet the spirit and intent of the following regulations:
- California Accidental Release Prevention (CalARP) Program - Title 19 CCR, Chapter 4.5
- Federal EPA Risk Management Program (RMP) - Title 40 CFR §68
- California Process Safety Management (PSM) Program, Title 8 CCR §5189
- Federal Process Safety Management (PSM) Program, Title 29 CFR §1910.119

Hereafter this program will be referred to as the RMP-PSM program.

This program is intended to be a living document. As such, the information, procedures, policies, and documentation that make up this program must be made easily accessible and updated as necessary. To accomplish this, Vignolo Delmart Cold Storage has elected to use PSMWriter, software developed and distributed by Resource Compliance, Inc. This software will assist us with updating, 
maintaining, scheduling, and tracking RMP-PSM related activities. 

1.1 Vignolo Delmart Cold Storage, Risk and Process Safety Management Program

This is to inform all interested persons, including employees, that Vignolo Delmart Cold Storage has updated/developed their unified RMP-PSM Program. This program has been prepared to address the risks involved in operating and maintaining the following process which have the presence of hazardous chemicals above threshold quantities: 

Process Name            | Process Chemical          | Process Quantity(lbs.)
Ammonia Refrigeration     Anhydrous Ammonia           40,000

Our RMP-PSM program promotes overall plant, worker, and public safety. The program enables our facility to prevent the occurrence, and minimize the consequences, of significant releases of hazardous chemicals. Overall, the program is designed to prevent accidental fatalities, injuries, illnesses and physical property damage.

Our company has many policies and procedures in place to promote overall plant, worker and public safety. We have: 
Prepared a unified program based on the PSM plan t
